studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Evaluation of Axicabtagene Ciloleucel versus Standard of Care (SOC) in Phase 3 randomized setting for r/r DLBCL.
Implementation of a planned interim futility analysis reviewed by the DSMB.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: To compare efficacy and safety of CAR T-cell therapy against platinum-based salvage chemotherapy and ASCT in early relapsed/refractory patients.
Address the significant unmet need in patients resistant to first-line rituximab-based chemoimmunotherapy.

studyChanges.beforeText: Not explicitly provided in the provided text snippet for previous versions.
studyChanges.afterText: Target dose of 2 x 10^6 anti-CD19 CAR T cells/kg; minimum of 1 x 10^6 anti-CD19 CAR T cells/kg; maximum flat dose of 2 x 10^8 for subjects > 100 kg.
studyChanges.summary: Defined specific dosing tiers and maximum flat dose for axicabtagene ciloleucel based on ZUMA-1 data.

studyChanges.afterText: Randomization will be stratified by response to first-line therapy and second-line age-adjusted IPI (0 to 1 vs 2 to 3).
studyChanges.summary: Clarified the stratification factors for the randomization process.

studyChanges.afterText: SOC will consist of protocol-defined, platinum-based salvage combination chemotherapy (R-ICE, R-GDP, R-DHAP, or R-ESHAP).
studyChanges.summary: Specified the allowed standard of care chemotherapy regimens for the control arm.
